definition: careless/casual/vague/not so bad/so-so/tolerable/fair
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He learned carelessly and was not hard-working at all.
sentences.chinese: 他學習馬馬虎虎，很不用功。

sentences.english: He tinkered with my old clock.
sentences.chinese: 他馬馬虎虎地修理我的舊鐘。

sentences.english: Don't palter with this question, answer it properly.
sentences.chinese: 不要馬馬虎虎地對待這個問題，好好回答。

sentences.english: He was castigated for his carelessness in doing homework.
sentences.chinese: 他由於做作業時馬馬虎虎而受到申斥。

sentences.english: He does his work anyhow, without taking any care or trouble over it.
sentences.chinese: 他幹起活來馬馬虎虎，既不當心，又不認真。

sentences.english: B. Just so-so. Are you still working at your old company?
sentences.chinese: 馬馬虎虎。你還在原來的公司上班嗎？

sentences.english: Products must be strictly, not carelessly, inspected before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 產品出廠要嚴格檢查，馬馬虎虎可不行。

sentences.english: Don’t scamp your work because you are pressed for time.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲時間倉促而馬馬虎虎。

sentences.english: The female knot-tying weaverbird will refuse to mate with a male who has built a shoddy nest.
sentences.chinese: 會打結的雌織巢鳥不肯同造窩馬馬虎虎的雄鳥交配。

sentences.english: We went hitchhiking for two weeks and lived catch - as - catch - can.
sentences.chinese: 我們搭便車旅行兩週，生活過得馬馬虎虎。

sentences.english: It was just so-so on the software side.
sentences.chinese: 這只是馬馬虎虎在軟件方面。
湯姆馬馬虎虎地把鍾修了一下。

sentences.english: Mary:just so-so. I am busy in College English Test, Band Four, and you?
sentences.chinese: 馬馬虎虎，我最近忙於大學英語四級考試。你呢？

sentences.english: Do you acquaint with directional well craft the technique? Yes, know some. So so.
sentences.chinese: 你熟悉定向井工藝技術？知道一些。馬馬虎虎。

sentences.english: Such slovenly work habits will never produce good products.
sentences.chinese: 這樣馬馬虎虎的工作習慣決不能生產出優質產品來。

sentences.english: Edward:Just so-so. Are you still working at your old company?
sentences.chinese: 馬馬虎虎。你還在原來的公司上班嗎？

definition: to force someone to do something
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
clear and logical
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
genuine and sincere (idiom)/wholehearted
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
